Summary: Biochemical reaction from n-desethyl sunitinib to didesethyl sunitinib. This interaction is catalyzed by CYP3A4.
Biochemical reaction from sunitinib to n-desethyl sunitinib. This interaction can be catalyzed by CYP3A4, CYP1A2, CYP3A5 or CYP1A1.
Biochemical reaction from sunitinib to sunitinib n-oxide.
PDGFRB leads to VEGF Signaling Pathway.
PDGFRA leads to VEGF Signaling Pathway.
KIT leads to VEGF Signaling Pathway.
FLT3 leads to VEGF Signaling Pathway.
KDR leads to VEGF Signaling Pathway.
FLT4 leads to VEGF Signaling Pathway.
FLT1 leads to VEGF Signaling Pathway.
Transport from sunitinib to sunitinib. This interaction can be catalyzed by ABCB1 or ABCG2.
